intro: Cerbera manghas var. acutisperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves with a pointed tip. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by round, purple fruits resembling those of the common mangosteen. Its botanical features include smooth, bark-like stems and a compact growth habit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of medicinal compounds.
